modules.report
Class ReportRequestFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      com.ui.AbstractModelessWindow
                          modules.report.ReportRequestFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
WindowProcessTemplateListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class ReportRequestFrame
extends AbstractModelessWindow
implements javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener

Window for allowing the user to setup and submit requests for various reports.

Once reqeuested, the report will be generated on the designated UNIX server, and depending on the metho d of invocateion, will be returned back to the Launch Pad application for viewing and/or printing. This window does not require any security and can be invoked straight from the Launch Pad main menu withot being logged into the system.

For each report, the user will have the option of printing the report immediately, or bringing the report back for examination prior to printing. Some reports will have additional parameters as needed. Once the user selects a report, the window will gather the required arguments and perform the following sequence of events:

  1. Launch Pad (LP) opens a separate thread for the requested report.
  2. The new thread opens a socket to the Unix server.
  3. LP passes the report ID and arguments to the server.
  4. If the report is designated as print-only, the server will respond with an acknowledgement (instead of the report) after receiving the arguments. In this case, LP will close the socket after receiving the acknowledgment.
  5. Otherwise, the server will generate the text report, then return it to LP via the socket.
  6. After LP finishes receiving the report, it will close the socket.
  7. LP will display the report in a window, and offer the user the opportunity to search and/or print.
Most of the reports require only a fraction of a second to finish. However, certain reports require several minutes for completion. This is why a separate thread (and window) should be opened for each report request, so that Launch Pad is not frozen while waiting for the data to be returned. The report data returned to Launch Pad will be in the form of an ASCII text file. The only special character returned will be a control-L, which indicates a page feed.

Author:
rterrell
See Also:

initFrame

protected void initFrame()
Performs specific constructor related tasks for this window.

Changes the text of the cancel and Ok buttons to "Exit PC List" and "Close PC", respectively. Adds the refresh button and dht find sku button and arranges the order which the buttons are displayed.

Returns:

Throws:
InvalidDataException - A validation error regarding any of the report parameters.

processData

public java.lang.Object processData(java.lang.Object data)
                             throws LaunchPadException
Submits the report request to the UNIX server for processing.

A separate thread is utilize for submitting the report request for the sole purpose of not blocking the application in the event the report yields a long running process. Most of the reports require only a fraction of a second to finish. However, certain reports require serveal minutes to process, hence, the need for an additional thread.

Specified by:
processData in interface WindowProcessTemplateListener
Parameters:
data - The report request String disguised as an arbitrary object.
Returns:
The report request String disguised as an arbitrary object.
Throws:
LaunchPadException

validateInputParameters

protected java.lang.String validateInputParameters()
                                            throws InvalidDataException
Validates the contents of all report parameters displayed for the selected report.

All parameters are required to have a value.

Returns:
A String containing the value of each parameter in the order displayed on the screen. Each value is separated by a space since all parameter values contain no spaces.
Throws:
InvalidDataException - A parameter was found to be invalid.

validateParameter

protected java.lang.String validateParameter(java.lang.String parmType,
                                             ReportRequestFrame.ParameterComponentInfo comp)
                                      throws InvalidDataException
Validates a single report parameter.

The list below contains the valid parameter types:

Parmater Type Desription
PrintOrDisplay Either “P” or “D”
PCNumber Number between 6 and 10 digits
DaysOut Field should default to 8 and allow values from 1 to 10
XferNumber Number between 6 and 15 digits
Date A valid date (passed with format “mm/dd/yyyy”)
RTVNumber Number between 4 and 9 digits
Dept Number between 1 and 5 digits
StartDate Starting date in a date range. Must be paired with an end date.
EndDate Ending date in a date range. Should be greater than or equal to the start date.

Parameters:
parmType - A String representing the parameter type.
comp - An instance of ReportRequestFrame.ParameterComponentInfo, which contains the actual input component, related to the parameter where the value entered by the user can be obtained.
Returns:
The value of the parameter entered by the user.
Throws:
InvalidDataException - When parmType is found not to have a value or its data is invalid.

buildReportRequest

protected java.lang.String buildReportRequest(java.lang.String parmList)
                                       throws InvalidDataException
Constructs a report request based on the the parameter list values, reqValues.

Each report request will contain at least three arguments. They are 1) the length of the request as a four byte ASCII value, 2) the report ID, and 3) a flag indicating whether the report should be printed or displayed. Additional arguments are included depending on the specific report. Each argument will be separated by a space. As an example, the transfer extract report will require three parameters: 

    1) Request Length
    2) Report ID
    3) Flag indicating Print or Display
    4) Extract Date.
So the data passed to the Unix server will look like this:
0025xfer-extract D 01/25/2012.

Parameters:
parmList - A String containing a list of all the values of the report parameters where each value is separated by a space.
Returns:
The complete report request.
Throws:
InvalidDataException - Inability to obtain the report id of the selected report.
